Of course! Here are the valid "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

I have removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name":

* "After" (this is a conjunction connecting the two independent clauses in the sentence)
* "which" (this is a pronoun referring to the previous noun "formation")
* "phase separation" (this is a term used in the context of materials science, but it is not a material name)
